results.title: Building a bridge: Tajik
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how, in three days of actual construction, one hundred Tajik men and boys from one village work together to rebuild their hand-construction bridge. No narration.

group_works.title: The Haunted huntress. Night of the leopard
group_works.creator_credit: Amanda Barrett, Keith Scholey, Owen Newman, BBC and National Geographic Society

results.title: The Haunted huntress. Night of the leopard
results.creator_credit: Amanda Barrett, Keith Scholey, Owen Newman, BBC and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of wildlife”.
Narrated by David Attenborough, “The Haunted huntress” looks at the changing fortunes of a cheetah mother and her cubs as they attempt to survive the harsh environment of Kenya’s Masai Mara. “Night of the leopard” reveals the amazing nocturnal world of a leopard mother and her cubs as she battles with lions, hyenas and crocodiles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Amanda Barrett, Keith Scholey, Owen Newman, BBC and National Geographic Society

results.title: Timeline
results.creator_credit: Leo Eaton, Holmes Associates and Maryland Public Television
results.brief_description: Timeline is an innovative series for schools presenting historical events in a newscast format. The focus of the series is on events which occured in the Middle Ages.

group_works.title: The Black death, 1361
group_works.creator_credit: Leo Eaton, Altug Savasal, Diane Holmes and Maryland Public Television

results.title: The Black death, 1361
results.creator_credit: Leo Eaton, Altug Savasal, Diane Holmes and Maryland Public Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Timeline”.
A dramatic recreation of the social upheaval experienced in the Middle Ages due to the spread of the Black Death. Modelled on a news broadcast, the program looks at the causes and impact of the Plague, and “interviews” key historical figures of the time. At its most virulent, the disease decimated both city and rural populations and created severe labour shortages.

results.title: The Lottery
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
An adaptation of Shirley Jackson’s chilling story about a small American town and its annual lottery ritual. Explores the concepts of violence and tradition, highlighting their senselessness in our time. Suiable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hunt
results.creator_credit: David Deverell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
A hunting trip turns into a deadly manhunt, touching on themes of man’s relationship to his environment, animals and other people. Adapted from a story by Richard Connell.

results.title: Dr Heidegger's experiment
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
An adaptation of Nathaniel Hawthorne’s symbolic tale of a wise old doctor who proves to his friends that age and wisdom are not necessarily synonymous.

results.title: A Discussion of Herman Melville's 'Bartleby'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
The student is given an opportunity to develop his own independent critical analysis of the book and then to compare his ideas with those of the critic Charles Van Doren who has considered the work in depth. Explores the many possibilities for creative interpretation.
